title: Synthetic Recap
body:
WASHINGTON – On a night when the rest of the league was put on notice, Chris Webber authored a performance for the ages, single-handedly dismantling the Orlando Magic in a 104-93 Bullets victory.

Webber was nothing short of a force of nature, pouring in a career-high and breathtaking 41 points. He was unstoppable from the opening tip, attacking the rim with a ferocious blend of power and finesse. His dominance wasn't limited to scoring; he also controlled the glass, hauling in a game-high 13 rebounds to complete a monstrous double-double that left the Magic defense scrambling for answers all night.

While Webber’s historic night was the headline, he received crucial support from his backcourt. Rod Strickland orchestrated the offense with precision, dishing out 12 assists and keeping the Bullets’ attack fluid and unpredictable. Calbert Cheaney provided an efficient secondary scoring punch, adding 18 points to help fuel the home team's offensive onslaught.

Orlando, despite a valiant 26-point effort from the explosive Penny Hardaway and a 19-point contribution from Rony Seikaly, simply had no answer for the Webber onslaught. The Magic fought to stay within striking distance, but every time they threatened, Webber had a response—a thunderous dunk, a silky jumper, or a crucial rebound.

The final score solidified a decisive win for Washington, but the true story of the night was the arrival of Chris Webber as an undeniable superstar. His 41-point eruption wasn't just a win; it was a statement, a historic performance that announced his arrival among the league's elite and sent a jolt of electricity through the capital.
